TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed UIStatusBarStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The visual style of the status bar.

remarks.para: Starting in iOS 7, the status bar does not have background content, so application developers must ensure that the style of the status bar works with the content of the that will appear behind it. The style of the status bar presents dark content (i.e., its text and content are dark). If the underlying view has dark content, the status bar will be more legible if the application developer overrides so that it returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle BlackOpaque = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle BlackOpaque = int64(2)

Docs.summary: Application developers should not use this deprecated style.

remarks.para: Application developers should not use this deprecated style. Specifying it will result in a return of .

.field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle BlackTranslucent = int64(1)

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle Default = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle Default = int64(0)

Docs.summary: The default, dark, value for content in the status bar. Preferable for use with lighter-colored content views.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle LightContent = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.UIKit.UIStatusBarStyle LightContent = int64(1)

Docs.summary: Content in the status bar is drawn with light values. Preferable for use wth darker-colored content views.
